documents.title: national theatre axes sunday shows
text: ralph fiennes in antony and cleopatra ( as antony ) , andrew garfield in angels in america and tamsin greig as a female version of twelfth night 's malvolio are just a few of the star turns that will be seen at the national theatre between now and 2018 .
but do n't try to catch any of them on sunday , as the venue plans to phase out performances on that day from april .
nt boss rufus norris told journalists earlier that sunday shows - which began at the theatre in 2008 - were `` always the last to sell '' .
`` given the tight financial situation that we are in , we decided that was one of the things we had to give up , '' said executive director lisa burger .
new stagings of amadeus , hedda gabler and the threepenny opera were also announced as norris unveiled the national 's plans for 2016 and beyond .
it 's also been announced that sir lenny henry , who trod the boards at the national in 2011 in the comedy of errors , has been appointed to the nt board .

documents.title: breaking bad star salutes 'exciting ' trump
text: bryan cranston has been talking to radio 5 live 's colin paterson about trumbo , the biopic of blacklisted hollywood screenwriter dalton trumbo that has seen the breaking bad star nominated for this year 's best actor oscar .

during the interview , cranston offered some thoughts on donald trump , the us real estate mogul turned republican presidential candidate who , in his own way , is no less divisive a figure as trumbo was 60 years ago .
donald trump is an exciting personality .
he is literally a game show host , a reality tv star who is now the front-runner in one of our major parties for president of the united states .
it is like a story out of a reality show in of itself .
there is something very refreshing about donald trump .
he is not measured ; he speaks his mind here 's a man who is getting traction , he has supporters .
but i think [ that ] common sense and level-headed , intelligent-minded people will eventually reject his points-of-view . ''
trumbo is out in the uk on friday .
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

documents.title: dara o briain 'thrilled ' to host robot wars
text: dara o briain has said he is `` thrilled '' to be the new host of robot wars when the series returns to bbc two this year .
the comedian will be joined by irish broadcaster angela scanlon ( below ) , with sports reporter jonathan pearce returning as commentator .
the new series will come from a new , purpose-built fighting arena in glasgow .
the original series , which aired from 1998 to 2002 , saw teams of amateur engineers and their robot creations go head to head with a competitor in a battle to the death ( well , dismantling ) .
the new six-part series promises a `` raft of technological advances '' .
here 's what o briain had to say about it .

for too long , the schedules have cried out for a show in which dedicated amateurs , toiling day and night , handcraft sophisticated automatons built on the delicate interplay of hand-wired servo motors with custom-built circuit boards and fingertip motion control , just to see them get smashed to pieces by a dustbin carrying a massive hammer .
it 's war , and how i love it so .
read more on this story .

documents.title: love story co-stars return to boston
text: ryan o'neal and ali mcgraw paid a nostalgic visit this week to harvard university , 45 years on from their characters ' fateful meeting there in 1970 weepie love story .

the actors - now 74 and 76 respectively - arrived on campus on monday in an antique mg convertible , similar to the car their characters drove in the film , for which both are most fondly remembered .
o'neal and mcgraw are currently hoping to coin fresh memories in love letters , a touring production of ar gurney 's play that can be seen at boston 's citi performing arts center this week .
the play - a popular one for actors of a certain vintage - tells of a man and a woman who maintain contact over 50 years through notes , cards and letters .

documents.title: mccartney portraits go on show in hastings
text: two portraits of sir paul mccartney go on display for the first time together this week as part of a major exhibition of work by john bratby at the jerwood gallery in hastings .
the paintings are part of a series of three portraits that the british artist made of the former beatle in the 1960s .
the whereabouts of the third is unknown .
bob hoskins , sir tom stoppard and the original cast of coronation street were among the other subjects bratby tackled .
but the artist fell out of fashion when the realist , 'kitchen sink ' style he represented became superseded by abstract and pop art .
john bratby : everything but the kitchen sink , including the kitchen sink runs at the jerwood until 17 april .

documents.title: visual effects society awards star wars and the revenant
text: with the oscars race now at the midway stage , the visual effects society has handed out its annual awards in los angeles .
star wars : the force awakens and the revenant both up multiple awards , while the much celebrated mad max : fury road up just one for its `` toxic storm '' sequence .
it could open up the academy awards visual effects category , where fury road is in the running against ex machina , the martian , the revenant and star wars .
on the tv side , game of thrones was the big winner in four categories .
ridley scott , director of the martian , was also presented with a lifetime achievement award at tuesday 's event .
read more on this story .

documents.title: kaws sculptures on show in yorkshire
text: a series of gigantic cartoon sculptures have popped up in the yorkshire countryside , in the first solo exhibition in the uk by us artist kaws .
the bbc 's arts editor , will gompertz , has been for a walk around the yorkshire sculpture park to take in the massive artworks .
here are his thoughts on the exhibition .
there 's no doubt about it , these sculptures look mighty incongruous in the wakefield landscape .
they are a long way from much of the other work that can be seen in the yorkshire sculpture park 's 500 acres .
not least , the modernist pieces produced by those two towering post-war british artists , dame barbara hepworth and sir henry moore , both of whom grew up within a few miles of the park .
their outdoor work responded to the landscape , and often aimed to be at one with it .

kaws ' pop art pieces have none of that subtlety - they are designed to jar and call attention to themselves : pieces of pop culture that were conceived in the urban environment now living wild among the trees and hills of england .
they wo n't be to everyone 's taste , but the formal questions they pose around scale , materials and context are worth dwelling upon .
from the australian outback to brazil 's sloping hills of iron , pop culture is all-pervasive , there is no escape - not even in the rolling hills of west bretton .

documents.title: halle berry : oscars lack of diversity 'heartbreaking '
text: halle berry , the first and , to date , only black actress to win the oscar for best actress has called the continuing lack of diversity in the academy award nominations `` heartbreaking '' .
speaking at the 2016 makers conference in the us , berry said she had inititally thought the oscar she won for monster 's ball in 2002 would be an agent for change .

i believed that in that moment , that when i said [ in my acceptance speech ] , 'the door tonight has been opened , ' i believed that with every bone in my body that this was going to incite change because this door , this barrier , had been broken .

since her win , only three african-american actresses have been nominated for the award : gabourey sidibe in 2010 for precious , viola davis in 2012 for the help , and quvenzhane wallis in 2013 for beasts of the southern wild .
berry said she was disappointed that none had repeated her success .
and to sit here almost 15 years later , and knowing that another woman of colour has not walked through that door , is heartbreaking .
it 's heartbreaking because i thought that moment was bigger than me .
it 's heartbreaking to start to think maybe it was n't bigger than me .
maybe it was n't .
and i so desperately felt like it was .
read more on this story .
author: People

documents.title: matthew perry 'scared ' over playwriting debut
text: former friends star matthew perry has admitted he was `` scared to write something on my own '' after enjoying so much success as chandler bing in the popular us sitcom .
`` i 'd never written anything by myself before , '' he told bbc arts correspondent rebecca jones .
`` i 'd always written with a partner .
`` [ but ] i started writing and these monologues came out , so i realised what i was writing was a play . ''
the result of his labours is the end of longing , a four-hander that begins previewing this week at london 's playhouse theatre .
the actor says the play will appeal to `` the friends generation '' with its story of `` four very broken people who are trying to find love . ''
listen to rebecca 's interview below and read more about the play here .
